revised_title: Study of the Trypanosome Causing Disease in Man in Nyasaland and its Effect on Various Animals
tldr: The study investigates the trypanosome causing disease in man in Nyasaland and its effects on various animals. The Naturally Infected Dog strain, although not fatal to oxen, goats, monkeys, and guinea-pigs, is highly virulent to dogs and rats, similar to the Human strain. The researchers found that the strain is an aberrant or exceptional variety of the trypanosome causing disease in man in Nyasaland, T. brucei vel rhodesiense.
